Hi Jan,

On 9/24/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>  > Why are you interested in logging during test cases? When mentoring
>  > other developers writing test cases, I discourage logging - if you
>  > want to know if an event has occurred, try using an assertion.
>
>  Assertions only show their messages when they fail.
>  Somethimes I find it usefull to have a log of what my tests have been
>  doing when they succeed.
>  When my testcase creates a new order, it's nice to log the order number.

Am I correct in assuming that these are integration/system tests that
you just happen to be writing on top of JUnit?


On 9/24/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>  Somethimes I find it usefull to have a log of what my tests have been
>  doing when they succeed.

Interesting. So you don't trust your test? I presume you're not doing
test-driven development?

-Lasse-
